org.opentosca.toscana.plugins.cloudfoundry.application

Class Application

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opentosca.toscana.plugins.cloudfoundry.application.Application

  • public class Application
extends java.lang.Object
    This class should describe a Application with all needed information to deploy it

    • Method Detail

      • addConfigMysql

        public void addConfigMysql(java.lang.String serviceInstanceName,
                           java.lang.String pathToFile)
        add in the deploy script the command to execute a sql file to the connected mysql database must be a .sql File If there is a script file to configure the database you have to use the executeFile method
        Parameters:
        serviceInstanceName - is the name of the service
        pathToFile - must be the path inside the csar. The method will create a relative path from it

      • addExecuteFile

        public void addExecuteFile(java.lang.String pathToFile,
                           RootNode parentTopNode)
        execute the given file on the warden container
        Parameters:
        pathToFile - must be the path inside the csar. The method will create a path on the warden container
        parentTopNode - Class of a RootNode which should be the top node of this stack. This is needed to get the right direction on the container

      • addExecuteFile

        public void addExecuteFile(java.lang.String pathToFile,
                           java.lang.String pathOnContainer)
        execute the given file on the warden container
        Parameters:
        pathToFile - must be the path inside the csar. The method will create a path on the warden container
        pathOnContainer - must be the path inside the container

      • getConfigMysql

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getConfigMysql()
        returns a map with realtive paths which should be executed with the python script configMysql

      • getExecuteCommands

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getExecuteCommands()
        returns a list with paths which should be executed with the python script executeCommand
        Returns:
        Key is the path to File and value is path to file on container

      • isRealApplication

        public boolean isRealApplication()
        true if the application is a real application false if the application is a dummy application e.g. a service default is true

      • applicationIsNotReal

        public void applicationIsNotReal(java.util.Set<Application> parentApplications)
        if the application is a dummy application e.g. a service default is true
        Parameters:
        parentApplications - a set of applications to which this application belongs to

      • getParentApplications

        public java.util.Set<Application> getParentApplications()
        Returns:
        the application to which this dummy application belongs to. Null if there is no parent.

      • setEnablePathToApplication

        public void setEnablePathToApplication(boolean enablePathToApplication)
        enable the path to the application file should use if only one file is for the application like .jar
        Parameters:
        enablePathToApplication - default is false. True means that there is no special path to application

      • isEnablePathToApplication

        public boolean isEnablePathToApplication()
        if true the application has one file which should be added to the path attribute
